emails.subject: URGENT: Your Account Will Be Suspended
emails.body:
Dear Valued Customer,

We have detected suspicious activity on your account. Your account will be suspended within 24 hours unless you verify your information immediately.

Click here to verify: http://paypal-verification.suspicious-site.ru/login

Failure to respond will result in permanent account closure.

Best regards,
PayPal Security Team

explanation.suspicious_sender: Sender uses domain paypaI-support.com (with capital I instead of l)
explanation.suspicious_link: Link leads to suspicious .ru domain instead of official PayPal
explanation.spelling_errors: No specific errors, but generally suspicious form
explanation.generic_greeting: Generic phrases like "Dear Valued Customer" instead of name

tips.title: What should you pay attention to?
info: Check the sender's email address carefully. Look for slight misspellings or unusual domains.
Be cautious of emails that create a sense of urgency or pressure you to act quickly.
Hover over links to see the actual URL before clicking. Avoid clicking on shortened or suspicious links.
Look for spelling and grammatical errors, which are common in phishing emails.
Be wary of generic greetings like 'Dear Customer' instead of your actual name.
Avoid opening unexpected attachments, especially if they are from unknown senders.
If you receive an invoice or package notification that you weren't expecting, verify its legitimacy through official channels.
Never provide personal or financial information in response to an unsolicited email.
